alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 8:32AM CDT until March 26 at 7:51AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following bayou in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Nacogdoches, Shelby, San Augustine and Rusk Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following bayou in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno, Texas. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Expect flooded paths and secondary roadways. Move livestock and equipment to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum bayou stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Wednesday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The bayou is expected to rise to a crest of 15.3 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued this morning at 930 AM CDT.
